sermons.title: (Following The Footsteps Of Christ) The Wilderness Of Judea
(Luke) 12 - Intro To The Temptation
sermons.description: The temptations in the wilderness served as the final preparation of our Lord Jesus.  This section is filled with mystery, yet has clear principles for us to grasp.  Brother Ed warns in closing that we're not to try to imitate Jesus in how He conquered temptation, but rather to appropriate Him, which is far higher.

sermons.title: (basics) 11. God's Word Helps Us Overcome Satan
sermons.description: Br. Zac Poonen speaks of the weapon of the Word of God in the life of the Christian believer. He speaks of how the enemy of our souls can bring condemnation and hurt but we must look to the Word of God to fight against satan. The Scriptures tell us we are justified in Jesus Christ and need to stand in our position against satan, discouragement and condemnation.

sermons.title: 34 Principle 30 - Reading the Entirety of Scriptures
sermons.description: For many Christians in countries with no persecution, having a Bibleâ€”the full Scriptures495â€”is often not appreciated. We do not realize that the Bible is our greatest physical treasure in this world. In persecuted nations our sisters and brothers weep over the Word of God and often only have parts of the New Testament or literally scraps of paper with copied Scripture verses on them. Yet for some in the body of Christ there is great abundant access to full Bibles in literally hundreds of translations.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 35 Principle 31 - Godly Disciplines for Assemblies
sermons.description: One of the hidden jewels of the Church is godly discipline. There has been a great lack of teaching and encouragement in modern evangelicalism towards the godly disciplines of: Fasting, waiting on God, early rising, head coverings, prevailing prayer, systematic Bible reading, Bible memorization, kneeling in prayer, and many other godly traditions in Church history.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: A Call To Repentance
sermons.description: Vance Havner preaches this message at a special meeting at Moody Bible Institute.  He ministers on the theme of repentance in the Bible. The last word of our Lord to the Church was repentance in the book of Revelation. Repentance is sorely missing and lacking in our day in modern gospel messages. This message is a call for believers to the place of repentance before God.

sermons.title: Evangelism I
sermons.description: "So much of that which lies dormant and latent within the Church," teaches Dana Congdon, "is ready to explode to life."  Dana looks at snapshots of the life of the Lord Jesus in the four Gospels to draw practical truths of what we are to be in our witness to lost people.  The methodology of evangelism is there is no methodology; you've got to know Jesus.  (Preached in Richmond on January 11, 1986)

sermons.title: HOW THE TURNING POINT CAME
sermons.description: If you can witness to His reality in your everyday relationships with people you are really fortunate! But what if just the opposite is true? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Logos in Nature
sermons.description: Thought, communication, and ideas cannot occur by random chance.  Dr. Smith shows how chance is not capable of producing instrumentation.   He discusses in this sermon how our instrumentation was designed in its origins to enjoy God and take pleasure in Him forever.  If we are not in the place of operating as our instrumentation was designed, we need to ask the Lord as to why we are all out of whack, in hopes that He will correct us.  Smith discusses how happy marriages are often an indication of God’s working in our instrumentation just like the Albatross happily maintains their monogamy for life, and revels in it with dancin

sermons.title: THEN I WOULD BE HAPPY
sermons.description: God is building a kingdom of love and happiness. How often we hear people say: “Oh, if only I had this or that, then I would be happy. But when our hopes are realized, usually our happiness doesn’t last. This meditation tells about a wish that can be fulfilled – a way that is guaranteed to bring happiness – lasting and everlasting!

sermons.title: THEN I WOULD BE HAPPY
sermons.description: God is building a kingdom of love and happiness. How often we hear people say: “Oh, if only I had this or that, then I would be happy. But when our hopes are realized, often our happiness doesn’t last.  The following meditation tells about a wish that can be fulfilled – a way that is guaranteed to bring lasting happiness.

sermons.title: Temptation of Christ
sermons.description: Pastor Fitch begins with a brief exposition of the third temptation of Christ and shows how behind the world is the god of this world and how the church often leaves the 'd' off of devil. He explains how to love this world is to worship the prince of it. And finally how the Lord has overcome the world.

sermons.title: The Context of the Sermon on the Mount â€“ Part 1
sermons.description: The Sermon on the Mount is considered to be one of Jesus' most important discourses and one of His most foundational teachings, considered to hold the essence of Jesus' teaching. Even many who are not Christians believe this sermon is one of the most important messages ever taught. There is perhaps no passage in the Bible that is quoted more and understood less than this teaching in Matthew 5-7.

sermons.title: The Deadly Look
sermons.description: There is a look that kills. Things may look good but not be good for you. Lot thought it looked good to go toward Sodom and Gomorrah, but he lost everything he had there. There's a way that looks right to man but the end of it is death. Looks can be deceiving. The lust of man's flesh, the sight of the eyes and the pride of life are examined carefully.

sermons.title: The First Word of the Gospel
sermons.description: Dr. Orr discusses the modern corruption of the word 'repent,' what the Scriptural meaning is, and discusses the Greek word that was translated into 'repent.' The main push of the message is that the gospel always begins and continues with repentance, and that the gospel preached without it is not the true gospel at all. "Now, would it not be a master stroke of the enemy of the Christian faith to take the very first word of the gospel and change its meaning...well that's exactly what's been done."

sermons.title: Urge To Sin - The Mental Factor
Whatever Happened to Repentance Preaching
sermons.description: There are very few messages on repentance these days. Contemporary churches would rather appease the congregation than to preach the offense of the cross. There is a thirst all around the world today for truth. The only way for people to be healed and enter into the power and rest of Christ is through repentance. The Holy Spirit is grieved at those who never enter into the Joy of Jesus through repentance. The devil is after the fruitfulness and Christ likeness in our lives. The devil will send foxes to hinder our fruitfulness. Jesus will come and call us to rise up with Him and He will battle for us and go after these foxes. We must be fully convinced of the love of God and His desire to fight against our enemies and to keep us by His power. He will do battle with us and for us.
